intro: Ceropegia langkawiensis, commonly known as the Langkawi ceropegia, is a rare and endemic species native to the island of Langkawi in Malaysia. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Apocynaceae family, characterized by its trailing stems and tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone areas, adapting to the arid and nutrient-poor conditions of its habitat. Its unique floral structure is adapted for specific pollinators, contributing to its ecological significance. Due to its limited distribution and habitat threats, it is considered a conservation concern.
